result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek A. Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:30 AM Defendant Derek A. Dixon in court in person and in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald in person.  David S Olson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and no contest to counts 2 and 5. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 2, and 5. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. On counts 1 and 2, Court orders sentence withheld 4 years probation on each count consecutive to count 5. As conditions of probation, defendant is to complete a domestic violence intervention program recommended by DOC and complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. No contact with victim R.M. unless approved by both R.M. and DOC. Take all medications as prescribed. On count 5, Court orders 9 months jail concurrent with 21CM214 and 21CM215. Full Huber. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 81 days on count 5 only.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:09 AM Defendant Derek A. Dixon in court in custody by video with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
